summary: The document is an exhibit cover sheet from the JFK assassination system records, detailing a copy of a letter by Philip LaChapelle Jr. to the adopted father of Kenneth Co Griggs, a PFC who died in Korea in 1946. It includes agency details, document type, classification, and restrictions, noting it was released with deletions and is unclassified. The document sheds light on the letter's content and its significance to an investigation.
key_findings: The document is part of the JFK assassination system records.
It references a letter from Philip LaChapelle Jr. regarding Kenneth Co Griggs, a soldier who died in Korea.
The document was released with deletions and is marked as unclassified.
Includes details about the investigation and the parties involved in the correspondence.
